commit_message:
Re-enable experimental jobs in osh-infra

This adds the experimental jobs back to osh-infra, as they were
erroneously disabled via comments in a previously merged change

Change-Id: Id92c24223f8c22f1a0ff82b62c222b2920ecd929
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

commit_message:
Update egress HTK method

This patch set places logic to generate kubernetes egress network policy
rule based on the dependencies specified in values.yaml. This also sets
up the necessary default network policy for the OSH gate.

Change-Id: I1ac649cc9debb5d1f4ea0a32f506dcda4d8b8536
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
Escape invalid JSON characters during deployment.

By first quoting the JSON query, it is possible to easily pass
it to the json_query plugin. This allows elements with special
characters, such as a hyphen -, to be resolvable.

Change-Id: I56f3e5f96dc25f16aed585ca6678de53721071b7
Closes-Bug: #1853321
Signed-off-by: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add groups.yaml containing Validation Groups definition

This file will be the source of reference for all the groups used by
tripleo-Validations. It will be deployed next to the playbooks/roles[1]
in order to parsed by the TripleO Validator CLI and its new
subcommand[2].

It will also be the reference for the tripleo-validations documentation
and will be automated in a follow up patch.

[1] - /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-validations/groups.yaml
[2] - openstack tripleo validator group list

Change-Id: I56b9d39c113cfb30695fe8cf2740ae147b0dd3e4
(cherry picked from commit 6df86cdffe3d92b493926140076686c6352c432c)
(cherry picked from commit f43f1cf9f753b4b8d911e6ca61e8cc7cdab5a0e2)

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-21 17:46:03.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid multiple calls to Glance happening in api.nova.server_list()

Achieve this by preparing a dictionary of images to be later used by
api.nova.Server - and prepare them prior to wrapping entities fetched
with novaclient with api.nova.Server. Thus the number of calls to
Glance API being made in api.nova.server_list() when the image entity
within a Server lacks name will be reduced.

Closes-Bug: #1508554
Change-Id: Iac485c1b448011fec97ba5bfaa83851914b294d9
'}, {'created': '2015-10-22 11:06:32.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid multiple calls to Glance happening in api.nova.server_list()

with novaclient with api.nova.Server. Thus the number of calls to

'}, {'created': '2015-11-03 14:02:55.000000000', 'message': "Avoid multiple calls to Glance happening in api.nova.server_list()

The solution proposed in this change accomplishes this by caching
glance images as they are encountered in the call to 'image_get' in
'api.nova.Server', thus eliminating the need for an API call the next
time an instance with the same image is found. Thus the number of
calls to Glance API being made in api.nova.server_list() when the
image entity within a Server lacks name will be reduced.

The usage of cache most likely will become obsolete when Glance will
be able to give back several images with one request, see
https://goo.gl/LWPKcK

Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Sutyagin <dsutyagin@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Paul Karikh <pkarikh@mirantis.com>

Closes-Bug: #1508554
Change-Id: Iac485c1b448011fec97ba5bfaa83851914b294d9
"}, {'created': '2015-11-03 14:30:32.000000000', 'message': "Avoid multiple calls to Glance happening in api.nova.server_list()

The solution proposed in this change accomplishes this by caching
glance images as they are encountered in the call to 'image_get' in
'api.nova.Server', thus eliminating the need for an API call the next
time an instance with the same image is found. Thus the number of
calls to Glance API being made in api.nova.server_list() when the
image entity within a Server lacks name will be reduced.

The usage of cache most likely will become obsolete when Glance will
be able to give back several images with one request, see
https://goo.gl/LWPKcK

"}, {'created': '2017-12-01 15:10:23.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid multiple calls to Glance happening in api.nova.server_list()

Server list triggers call to Glance for each server, even if server
is booted from same image. Such behavior is suboptimal and leads
to many unnecessary requests to Glance.

This patch uses glance list filtering, which allow to query images
for the list of required ids. See [1] for details.

[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/image/v2/#show-images

Closes-Bug: #1508554
Change-Id: Iac485c1b448011fec97ba5bfaa83851914b294d9

commit_message:
Call Glance list with certain image ids

This patch uses glance list filtering, which allow to query images
for the list of required ids. See [1] for details.

Patch rebased to master. Added test for proposed Glance API request

[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/image/v2/#show-images

Related-Bug: #1508554
Co-Authored-By: Ivan Kolodyazhny <e0ne@e0ne.info>
Co-Authored-By: Vadym Markov <markov.vadim@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Iac485c1b448011fec97ba5bfaa83851914b294d9

commit_message:
Remove test for msgfmt import

The infra scripts test that msgfiles are correct and will not import
anything. Remove the test - especially since it fails when no
translations are available.

Change-Id: Iadca470d5e6e11dfcc3d7b72c6ad636d6f6dc5df
Signed-off-by: Yuanbin.Chen <cybing4@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Make admin user have access to other project's cluster

as administrator priviledge, admin user should be necessary to retrieve
the resources of all projects.

commit_message:
Move charts off using the :latest built tags

This updates charts that consume images built from osh-images to
use tags other than the :latest tags. This will be followed up
with the definition of jobs to allow for vetting out of updated
images, as reliance on :latest tags assumes any change merged into
osh-images will result in functionally correct behavior (which has
shown to not be the case traditionally)

Change-Id: I181aa56ed187604dc7583d8081e53cc69eb27310
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

The YAML output from the owners utility can be useful for
demographic analysis of OpenStack contributors as well as vetting
candidates for election. In some cases, candidate affiliation
matters explicitly, for example in the member affiliation diversity
requirement of the TC charter. Since OSF member profiles often

Change-Id: I2e866ee21cbc20517f205726b91abeb361abfdbf

commit_message:
Add affiliations and country to structured data

The YAML output from the owners utility can be useful for
demographic analysis of OpenStack contributors as well as vetting
candidates for election. In some cases, candidate affiliation
matters explicitly, for example in the member affiliation diversity
requirement of the TC charter. Since OSF member profiles often
contain affiliation and country, incorporate them into the resulting
YAML detail.

Change-Id: I2e866ee21cbc20517f205726b91abeb361abfdbf

commit_message:
Track oldest and newest Gerrit change numbers

When including oldest and newest change merged dates for entries in
the structured data sets, also provide additional newest_id and
oldest_id fields with the corresponding Gerrit change numbers for
added verifiability.

Change-Id: Ia9c53fc5e8cc2af0cbbfafa5fba0408858f9bd4f

commit_message:
Include contributors to repos for SIGs in TC rolls

It's been the intent ever since the TC started keeping a record of
what Git repositories are controlled by official SIGs, that the
contributors to those repositories should be eligible to vote in TC
elections. Add that feature, along with a command-line option for
specifying a non-default file in the event the official one needs to
be overridden, and use the same zeroing logic as is used for
skipping the legacy file for retired repositories, for the same
reasons.

Change-Id: I65d2a620a0e4b81d0ef685a7fedb0e7800cbff9f

commit_message:
No longer match on repository short names

With the expansion of OpenDev's hosting, it is no longer guaranteed
that the last component of a repository's name is globally unique in
the OpenDev Gerrit deployment. Continuing to assume otherwise risks
incorrectly including the wrong projects in electoral roll
generation.

Change-Id: I1e96789d51dc53433b329cd13d4204301b2f07f3

commit_message:
Add a -v/--verbose option to owners utility

Similar to other command-line tools, give the owners utility a
verbose option supporting multiple verbosity levels, for added
debugging capability.

Change-Id: I839c8302db4a9ad887f175b5b0efc64fdc114ab9

commit_message:
Use --containerized flag to support 1.{13,14,15}.x in Atomic

The flag has been removed in Kubernetes version 1.16.x for which users
should use Podman but to continue to use Fedora Atomic without
use_podman=true which means using Docker 1.13.x, ServiceAccount tokens
cannot be propagated without using the --containerized flag when
use_podman=false.

This flag should not have been removed in
I3efd4e55e885b95721f13279b44dc1246e2fd2e4.

Story: 2006846
Task: 37434

Change-Id: I5ccef63de928ff01d10dc4cc500d0e1583eb0378

commit_message:
Allow empty common_featureset

Fixed bug that prevented disabling common_featureset in child jobs.

Now we can give define a non-true value in order to disable it.

Change-Id: Ifdf2c580f42ca40ab6b20db6bb663d355f92b5c1

commit_message:
Drop python2 tests

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.
magnum is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html#completion-criteria

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/693631

Change-Id: I2ce19b3f976619853117231ae0dae24ebe68601f
Signed-off-by: Diogo Guerra <diogo.filipe.tomas.guerra@cern.ch>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-24 15:26:14.000000000', 'message': "WIP: docs: Rewrite host aggregate, availability zone docs

These closely related features are the source of a disproportionate
number of bugs and a large amount of confusion among users. The spread
of information around multiple docs probably doesn't help matters.

Do what we've already done for the metadata service and remote consoles
and clean these docs up. There are a number of important changes:

- All documentation related to host aggregates and availability zones is
  placed in one of three documents, '/user/availability-zones',
  '/admin/aggregates' and '/admin/availability-zones'. (note that there
  is no '/user/aggregates' document since this is not user-facing

- References to these features are updated to point to the new location

- A glossary is added. Currently this only contains definitions for host
  aggregates and availability zones

- Some gaps in related documentation are closed

The '--keep-going' flag is added to the 'sphinx-build' call in 'tox.ini'
since I found it useful while debugging things I'd broken in the
process.

Change-Id: If847b0085dbfb4c813d4a8d14d99346f8252bc19
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

  '/admin/aggregates' and '/admin/availability-zones'. (note that there
  is no '/user/aggregates' document since this is not user-facing)

- References to these features are updated to point to the new location

- A glossary is added. Currently this only contains definitions for host
  aggregates and availability zones

- nova CLI commands are replaced with their openstack CLI counterparts

- Some gaps in related documentation are closed

Change-Id: If847b0085dbfb4c813d4a8d14d99346f8252bc19
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
docs: Rewrite host aggregate, availability zone docs

These closely related features are the source of a disproportionate
number of bugs and a large amount of confusion among users. The spread
of information around multiple docs probably doesn't help matters.

Do what we've already done for the metadata service and remote consoles
and clean these docs up. There are a number of important changes:

- All documentation related to host aggregates and availability zones is
  placed in one of three documents, '/user/availability-zones',
  '/admin/aggregates' and '/admin/availability-zones'. (note that there
  is no '/user/aggregates' document since this is not user-facing)

- References to these features are updated to point to the new location

- A glossary is added. Currently this only contains definitions for host
  aggregates and availability zones

- nova CLI commands are replaced with their openstack CLI counterparts

- Some gaps in related documentation are closed

Change-Id: If847b0085dbfb4c813d4a8d14d99346f8252bc19
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

recheck'}, {'account_id': 28748, 'date': '2019-11-21 05:19:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

After discussion at our irc meeting, I think +2 is appropriate, and if there is a need later, we can consider setting this to be configurable.'}, {'account_id': 14131, 'date': '2019-11-21 07:35:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

OK, hard code default_microversion as 'latest'.
And we can improve it later if needed."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-11-21 18:03:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Sorry I didn't catch this review earlier, but it is bad practice to use 'latest' as the default microversion.

If what you're trying to do is chase whatever microversion ends up exposing the new notification, and you have a chicken/egg dependency such that you can't actually wait until the nova side lands, then you should use 'latest' only on the *specific* call(s) that involve that notification, with a big fat TODO on those lines to cut over to the specific microversion when $patch lands."}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2019-11-21 21:00:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> you should use 'latest' only on the *specific* call(s)

We have only one Nova API call, i.e., /os-server-external-events. I have created a new task: https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2006921"}]

commit_message:
Set compute API microversion to 'latest' when calling Nova.

This is needed because the compute API microversion will
need to change to enable the Cyborg ARQ notification event.
(See https://review.opendev.org/#/c/692707 .)

Change-Id: I6a1ee1a282d15441fcd9d27300c4f60d52c2b8a6

commit_message:
Remove references to writable LDAP from documentation

Keystone removed support for writable LDAP backends in Ocata. Prior to
that it was deprecated for several releases. This commit removes
references to those configuration options since they are silently
ignored. This cleans up the configuration files and doesn't give the
impression that functionality is still supported.

Relevant release notes that advertize the removal:

  https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/keystone/ocata.html#relnotes-11-0-0-origin-stable-ocata-other-notes

Change-Id: Id05247d004ee7d189dff3ec867a6ec11dfc40e9b
(cherry picked from commit 83dc547d675b550de13278dce66961c7d45759c6)

commit_message:
Grafana: Add support for arbitrary environment variables

This updates the Grafana chart to support the definition of
arbitrary environment variables to support scenarios where
additional information may be required at runtime for things like
datasource and dashboard provisioning

Change-Id: I95e4abe9030116a440c6d78a1d14dbcaaf743b40
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

commit_message:
Delete instance_id_mappings record in instance_destroy

The instance_create DB API creates an instance_id_mappings record
but instance_destroy was not cleaning it up when the instance is
deleted; this adds that delete code. Otherwise those records
never get moved to shadow tables so you can't archive and purge them.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/684769

Change-Id: Idfe52d3c2f987b9aac551f013a0990423d87fad3
Closes-Bug: #1786298
(cherry picked from commit 8a6b57cf741e17d3de54ed8c85d9fb69c43e7432)
(cherry picked from commit 6186996c8093e723bdaa0e06664143685050312d)
(cherry picked from commit 1b6f48354b7eacecd7a146fc05a12537b4f22e18)

commit_message:
Adding missing tag for dynamic-address-fact task

Certain playbooks require dynamic facts at runtime and when
using tags like project-config, these tasks need to be called,
otherwise the template evaluation stops trying to resolve the facts.

Change-Id: I40e55671aed8df741e27ce8b2581b293a344afc0

commit_message:
Remove legacy-devstack-dsvm-updown job

This job is not used anymore, its usage got removed in
https://review.opendev.org/694989, so we can remove the definition now.

Change-Id: Id2d0337d64dc8dcd67ab7b5b9a121d7cba64949e

[{'created': '2019-11-12 12:46:57.000000000', 'message': "Only nil az during shelve offload

I25a4f36027390def83cfe25f4f3b4af9660da502 introduced a change to nil out
the instance availability zone during shelve offload and when build or
unshelve fails. This fix works since queens as in queens the feature
introduced by XXX to use the original alternate hosts during re-schedule.
As in pike we don't have such feature during reschedule nova does a full
new scheduler run. However I25a4f36027390def83cfe25f4f3b4af9660da502
removed the availability zone information from the instance which causes
the re-schedule to select host from outside of the originally requested
availability zone during re-schedule.

This patch makes the az cleaning selective. If this is called from
shelve offload then the az of the instance is cleaned but when it called
in any other case the az is not cleaned to make sure that the
re-schedule keeps the originally requested az.

Change-Id: I5924de15e28873783ce7cf58d54e12b8786abead
Closes-Bug: #1852207

commit_message:
Only nil az during shelve offload

I25a4f36027390def83cfe25f4f3b4af9660da502 introduced a change to nil out
the instance availability zone during shelve offload and when build or
unshelve fails. This fix works from queens as in queens
Iae904afb6cb4fcea8bb27741d774ffbe986a5fb4 added the feature to use the
original alternate hosts during re-schedule.

As in pike we don't have such feature during reschedule nova does a full
new scheduler run. However I25a4f36027390def83cfe25f4f3b4af9660da502
removed the availability zone information from the instance which causes
the re-schedule to select host from outside of the originally requested
availability zone during re-schedule.

This patch makes the az cleaning selective and makes sure that the az is
not cleaned if re-schedule is triggered.

Change-Id: I5924de15e28873783ce7cf58d54e12b8786abead
Closes-Bug: #1852207

[{'created': '2019-11-21 12:02:15.000000000', 'message': "Remove references to writable LDAP from documentation

Keystone removed support for writable LDAP backends in Ocata. Prior to
that it was deprecated for several releases. This commit removes
references to those configuration options since they are silently
ignored. This cleans up the configuration files and doesn't give the
impression that functionality is still supported.

Relevant release notes that advertize the removal:

  https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/keystone/ocata.html#relnotes-11-0-0-origin-stable-ocata-other-notes

Change-Id: Id05247d004ee7d189dff3ec867a6ec11dfc40e9b
(cherry picked from commit 83dc547d675b550de13278dce66961c7d45759c6)

commit_message:
Remove references to writable LDAP from documentation

Keystone removed support for writable LDAP backends in Ocata. Prior to
that it was deprecated for several releases. This commit removes
references to those configuration options since they are silently
ignored. This cleans up the configuration files and doesn't give the
impression that functionality is still supported.

Relevant release notes that advertize the removal:

  https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/keystone/ocata.html#relnotes-11-0-0-origin-stable-ocata-other-notes

Change-Id: Id05247d004ee7d189dff3ec867a6ec11dfc40e9b
(cherry picked from commit 83dc547d675b550de13278dce66961c7d45759c6)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-08 16:12:30.000000000', 'message': '[DNM] Ceph Nautilus compatibility

This change updates the Ceph charts to use Ubuntu Bionic images
instead of Xenial. The mirror that is used for Ceph packages only
supplies Nautilus packages for Bionic at present, so this is
necessary for Nautilus deployment.

There are also several configuration and scripting changes
included to provide compatibility with Ceph Nautilus. Most of
these simply allow existing logic to execute for Nautilus
deployments, but some logical changes are required to support
Nautilus as well.

NOTE: This patch set depends on ceph-disk being replaced with
ceph-volume. It should not be merged until that change is made.

Change-Id: If9d0f66b03b24cd1fde95071478b396ad2438bda
'}, {'created': '2019-11-08 18:58:20.000000000', 'message': '[DNM] Ceph Nautilus compatibility

This change updates the Ceph charts to use Ceph Nautilus images
build on Ubuntu Bionic instead of Xenial. The mirror that hosts
Ceph packages only provides Nautilus packages for Bionic at
present, so this is necessary for Nautilus deployment.

There are also several configuration and scripting changes
included to provide compatibility with Ceph Nautilus. Most of
these simply allow existing logic to execute for Nautilus
deployments, but some logical changes are required to support
Nautilus as well.

Dependencies:
https://review.opendev.org/682767 - ceph-disk replaced with

https://review.opendev.org/682767 - ceph-disk replaced with
ceph-volume
https://review.opendev.org/693577 - Bionic+Nautilus Docker images

Change-Id: If9d0f66b03b24cd1fde95071478b396ad2438bda

commit_message:
[DNM] Ceph Nautilus compatibility

This change updates the Ceph charts to use Ceph Nautilus images
build on Ubuntu Bionic instead of Xenial. The mirror that hosts
Ceph packages only provides Nautilus packages for Bionic at
present, so this is necessary for Nautilus deployment.

There are also several configuration and scripting changes
included to provide compatibility with Ceph Nautilus. Most of
these simply allow existing logic to execute for Nautilus
deployments, but some logical changes are required to support
Nautilus as well.

Dependencies:
https://review.opendev.org/682767 - ceph-disk replaced with
ceph-volume
https://review.opendev.org/693577 - Bionic+Nautilus Docker images

Change-Id: If9d0f66b03b24cd1fde95071478b396ad2438bda

commit_message:
[ceph-osd] fix the osd container name with host overrides

This is to fix the logic to allign the container name in both the
cases where host overrides used and not used.

right now if we use host overrides then container name coming as
"ceph-osd-default" and in case if no host override then
"ceph-<<$daemonset>>-osd".

Change-Id: I3cdaa3a3fd3592f776fd549e6b77e32b564800b1

This change modifies the Ceph image build scripts to build Bionic
images by default.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-30 13:05:02.000000000', 'message': 'Add configurable monitor timeouts for ovn dbs

Under pressure, the default monitor timeout value of 20 seconds is not
enough to prevent unnecessary failovers of the ovn-dbs pacemaker resource.
While spawning a few VMs in the same time this could lead to unnecessary
movements of master DB, then re-connections of ovn-controllers (slaves are
read-only), further peaks of load on DBs, and at the end it could lead to
snowball effect. Now this value can be configurable by
OVNDBSPacemakerTimeout which will configure
tripleo::profile::pacemaker::ovn_dbs_bundle (default is set to 60s)

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/692120/
Signed-off-by: Kamil Sambor <ksambor@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I1afb5f2ef31ec61b3b224e5e1672fb9f12bcb110
(cherry picked from commit ad1ef91aa4158c96356b13291605d8f2044f3069)
(cherry picked from commit ca335af7cba23a8159cf0d875fb87f37549ced53)
(cherry picked from commit a429b0cf0b5065b925db26ed6558ff2128d0cbe3)
'}, {'created': '2019-11-18 14:22:15.000000000', 'message': 'Add configurable monitor timeouts for ovn dbs

Under pressure, the default monitor timeout value of 20 seconds is not
enough to prevent unnecessary failovers of the ovn-dbs pacemaker resource.
While spawning a few VMs in the same time this could lead to unnecessary
movements of master DB, then re-connections of ovn-controllers (slaves are
read-only), further peaks of load on DBs, and at the end it could lead to
snowball effect. Now this value can be configurable by
OVNDBSPacemakerTimeout which will configure
tripleo::profile::pacemaker::ovn_dbs_bundle (default is set to 60s)

Signed-off-by: Kamil Sambor <ksambor@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1853000
Change-Id: I1afb5f2ef31ec61b3b224e5e1672fb9f12bcb110
(cherry picked from commit ad1ef91aa4158c96356b13291605d8f2044f3069)
(cherry picked from commit ca335af7cba23a8159cf0d875fb87f37549ced53)
(cherry picked from commit a429b0cf0b5065b925db26ed6558ff2128d0cbe3)
'}]
commit_message:
Add configurable monitor timeouts for ovn dbs

Under pressure, the default monitor timeout value of 20 seconds is not
enough to prevent unnecessary failovers of the ovn-dbs pacemaker resource.
While spawning a few VMs in the same time this could lead to unnecessary
movements of master DB, then re-connections of ovn-controllers (slaves are
read-only), further peaks of load on DBs, and at the end it could lead to
snowball effect. Now this value can be configurable by
OVNDBSPacemakerTimeout which will configure
tripleo::profile::pacemaker::ovn_dbs_bundle (default is set to 60s)

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/692120/
Signed-off-by: Kamil Sambor <ksambor@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1853000
Change-Id: I1afb5f2ef31ec61b3b224e5e1672fb9f12bcb110
(cherry picked from commit ad1ef91aa4158c96356b13291605d8f2044f3069)
(cherry picked from commit ca335af7cba23a8159cf0d875fb87f37549ced53)
(cherry picked from commit a429b0cf0b5065b925db26ed6558ff2128d0cbe3)

commit_message:
Don't install syslinux-nonlinux on rhel7

the syslinux tools are in the syslinux package on
rhel7 and friends, but in rhel8 have moved to
syslinux-nonlinux

Change-Id: Iea74c2be6fbd738f35f178fa189384dd37579277

commit_message:
Disable journald-remote playbook

The journald-remote playbook is disabled by default until
https://github.com/systemd/systemd/issues/2376 has been
incorporated in current systemd packages.

Change-Id: Ie70729eaad095b52813610b94c6618c84b05c148
Closes-Bug: #1853198
(cherry picked from commit 1bd21d80e47a66be145911d6be80992dbe0cc7c2)

commit_message:
Add configurable monitor timeouts for ovn dbs

Under pressure, the default monitor timeout value of 20 seconds is not
enough to prevent unnecessary failovers of the ovn-dbs pacemaker resource.
While spawning a few VMs in the same time this could lead to unnecessary
movements of master DB, then re-connections of ovn-controllers (slaves are
read-only), further peaks of load on DBs, and at the end it could lead to
snowball effect. Now this value can be configurable by
OVNDBSPacemakerTimeout which will configure
tripleo::profile::pacemaker::ovn_dbs_bundle (default is set to 60s)

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/692119/
Signed-off-by: Kamil Sambor <ksambor@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1853000
Change-Id: I1afb5f2ef31ec61b3b224e5e1672fb9f12bcb110
(cherry picked from commit ad1ef91aa4158c96356b13291605d8f2044f3069)
(cherry picked from commit ca335af7cba23a8159cf0d875fb87f37549ced53)

commit_message:
Add configurable monitor timeouts for ovn dbs

Under pressure, the default monitor timeout value of 20 seconds is not
enough to prevent unnecessary failovers of the ovn-dbs pacemaker resource.
While spawning a few VMs in the same time this could lead to unnecessary
movements of master DB, then re-connections of ovn-controllers (slaves are
read-only), further peaks of load on DBs, and at the end it could lead to
snowball effect. Now this value can be configurable by
OVNDBSPacemakerTimeout which will configure
tripleo::profile::pacemaker::ovn_dbs_bundle (default is set to 60s)

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/692114/
Signed-off-by: Kamil Sambor <ksambor@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1853000

Would it be better to break out those library portions of horizon into something that can be consumed by both Horizon and its plugins? Just a though - this is good.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-11-18 18:43:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-11-21 10:03:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-11-21 19:16:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Would it be better to break out those library portions of horizon into something that can be consumed by both Horizon and its plugins?

The horizon team discussed this topic several times so far.
Breaking the library part into a separate repo would be the ideal solution, but it did not happen so far from several reasons: mainly because it requires a lot of refactoring in the horizon repo especially in the JS side and due to the lack of development resources. Considering this, I believe it is a good compromise to change the release model to cycle-with-intermediary.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-18 13:46:06.000000000', 'message': 'Change horizon release model to cycle-with-intermediary

It was discussed in the Shanghai PTG.
horizon has two aspects: the one is to provide GUI to users and
the other is a library for horizon plugins.
When horizon plugins would like to use recent changes or to avoid bugs,
they need to consume beta releases of horizon.
More frequent releases of horizon would make more sense.
This commit changes the release model to cycle-with-intemediary.

After this change, horizon major version will be bumped when both
user-visible features and horizon plugin interfaces are dropped.
This menas the horizon major version can potentially be bumped
multiple times in a single development cycle.

Change-Id: I494063ca132b362cb769468fc588d71ec6264ca6
'}]
commit_message:
Change horizon release model to cycle-with-intermediary

It was discussed in the Shanghai PTG.
horizon has two aspects: the one is to provide GUI to users and
the other is a library for horizon plugins.
When horizon plugins would like to use recent changes or to avoid bugs,
they need to consume beta releases of horizon.
More frequent releases of horizon would make more sense.
This commit changes the release model to cycle-with-intemediary.

After this change, horizon major version will be bumped when both
user-visible features and horizon plugin interfaces are dropped.
This menas the horizon major version can potentially be bumped
multiple times in a single development cycle.

Change-Id: I494063ca132b362cb769468fc588d71ec6264ca6

commit_message:
Add configurable monitor timeouts for ovn dbs

Under pressure, the default monitor timeout value of 20 seconds is not
enough to prevent unnecessary failovers of the ovn-dbs pacemaker resource.
While spawning a few VMs in the same time this could lead to unnecessary
movements of master DB, then re-connections of ovn-controllers (slaves are
read-only), further peaks of load on DBs, and at the end it could lead to
snowball effect. Now this value can be configurable by dbs_timeout in
tripleo::profile::pacemaker::ovn_dbs_bundle and by default is set to 60s.

Change-Id: Ib95c6b7614631eed264d42e6cf61672b705e7893
Signed-off-by: Kamil Sambor <ksambor@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Ignore blacklisted nodes when rendering network config

We don't include nodes blacklisted with 'DeploymentServerBlacklist'
in 'ServerIdData' stack output, that is used to populate
'server_roles' dict. Let's ignore writing NetworkConfig for those.

Change-Id: I837ed2dd7937a87055a8acff686ca3165dba3837
Closes-Bug: #1853247
(cherry picked from commit 750a47956376b7e790744e3392d784aa8cfc3f86)

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Zun project is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/693631/

Co-Authored-By: Hongbin Lu <hongbin034@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ide32340821d015f6e02f33d2bdbf1ca238b3f68f

and now the playbook can handle it for us.

[{'created': '2019-10-23 14:42:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes issues with `rabbit_transport_url` method

When using rabbit_transport_url in a multi node environment, the address
used is the bind_address if we do not use a mq cluster, where it should
be the rabbit server endpoint hostname, if not we can end up with some
transport_url configurations as rabbit://<...>@0.0.0.0:<...>, if the
rabbit server is configured to listen on all interfaces.

Change-Id: If96ae42d836cbce43088efe483332cd2f7821457
Signed-off-by: Manuel Torrinha <manuel.torrinha@tecnico.ulisboa.pt>
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes issues with `rabbit_transport_url` method

When using rabbit_transport_url in a multi node environment, the address
used is the bind_address if we do not use a mq cluster, where it should
be the rabbit server endpoint hostname, if not we can end up with some
transport_url configurations as rabbit://<...>@0.0.0.0:<...>, if the
rabbit server is configured to listen on all interfaces.

Change-Id: If96ae42d836cbce43088efe483332cd2f7821457
Signed-off-by: Manuel Torrinha <manuel.torrinha@tecnico.ulisboa.pt>

subject: Fix invalid escapes in regular expression strings
messages: [{'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2019-11-21 13:21:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2019-11-21 16:34:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-11-21 16:37:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2019-11-21 16:56:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-21 13:21:52.000000000', 'message': 'Fix invalid escapes in regular expression strings

The "r" for raw strings has to repeated when several strings are
concatenated, otherwise the backslash in the strings that miss
the "r" are interpreted directly, and result in invalid escapes.

Change-Id: I3736a40043c8aa6c36c21803bf68f842af5cd55e
'}]
commit_message:
Fix invalid escapes in regular expression strings

The "r" for raw strings has to repeated when several strings are
concatenated, otherwise the backslash in the strings that miss
the "r" are interpreted directly, and result in invalid escapes.

Change-Id: I3736a40043c8aa6c36c21803bf68f842af5cd55e

commit_message:
RabbitMQ Exporter: Replace Direct Values w/ HTK

This change replaces direct references to the exporter port
in values.yaml with calls to helm-toolkit lookup functions.

The referenced port number under the network key is removed,
as the helm-toolkit function will return the port number under
the endpoints key.

Change-Id: Ib6f533c49af5a88fca377920d28d5468d7387892

commit_message:
Bump up ipa-ip-lookup-attempts to 6

To accommodate network setup that takes longer then
30 seconds increase the number of IP lookup attempts. This
allows for IPv6 setup that occurs after DHCP has time out.

Change-Id: I1351e150a63c6247210ca0cbc8ce0abfe82129cd

This commit implements option to partially override ceph.conf with regular
config_template action plugin.

commit_message:
FC improve logging

This patch improves logging for the FC connector and simplifies a couple
of list and dict creations using generators.

The logging is around the modification that os-brick does of the
connection dictionary that Cinder sent.  It displays what the contents
were on entry and on exit, and it also warns if we are dropping some
targets because the Cinder driver returned inconsistent data.

Change-Id: I44bfd4939a850e8e080c4f8760244146a75f7218

This change updates the entrypoint for Kafka to read settings
defined in values.yaml, exporting them to the environment, before
proceeding with the startup script provided by the image authors.

This process allows overriding default values for kafka's
server.properties as needed.

See start-kafka.sh for implementation details here:
https://github.com/wurstmeister/kafka-docker/blob/master/start-kafka.sh

most log4j settings are case sensitive which the script does not

commit_message:
Kafka: Add support for defining settings via overrides

This change updates the entrypoint for Kafka to read settings
defined in values.yaml, exporting them to the environment, before
proceeding with the startup script provided by the image authors.

This process allows us to override default values for kafka's
server.properties and log4j.properties files as needed.

See start-kafka.sh for implementation details here:
https://github.com/wurstmeister/kafka-docker/blob/master/start-kafka.sh

Change-Id: I08b055be2f898d48aff30c78c6a01e1ef2f8a05b

[{'created': '2019-11-17 17:48:55.000000000', 'message': '[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Senlin is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

Senlin is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/693631/
Change-Id: I0377788d0db0e60d44c35f1d26eefd58502a452a

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-12 11:50:24.000000000', 'message': "Add etcd auth token support

As of etcd v3.3.11, installations using etcd user authentication must
arrange for their grpc-gateway clients (which is what the Calico DHCP
agent and Neutron driver are) to provide an Authorization token on
each HTTP request.  This change enables that:

- the installer can configure an auth token for the Calico components
  to use, in 'etcd_auth_token' in neutron.conf

- the code changes here ensure that that token is included on each
  HTTP request.

Change-Id: Iac16beeedd3006b1e7cf3ee49cf2247e692ba434
"}, {'created': '2019-11-15 11:29:06.000000000', 'message': 'Support etcd v3.3.11 with authentication enabled

each HTTP request.  This change enables that:

- the installer can configure an auth username and password for the

commit_message:
Support etcd v3.3.11 with authentication enabled

As of etcd v3.3.11, installations using etcd user authentication must
arrange for their grpc-gateway clients (which is what the Calico DHCP
agent and Neutron driver are) to provide an Authorization token on
each HTTP request.  This change enables that:

- the installer can configure an auth username and password for the
  Calico components to use, in neutron.conf

- the code changes here use that config to obtain a token and ensure
  that that token is included on each HTTP request.

Change-Id: Iac16beeedd3006b1e7cf3ee49cf2247e692ba434

Exempt files like tox.ini or unit tests from triggering ansible
runs.

commit_message:
CI: Add mariadb test

Tests the following operations for MariaDB:

* Stop
* Recovery

Backup and restore will be added in a separate change.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/693329
Change-Id: I836d91554715cce0e82c1bbebb7430c457418b2d

overrides are handled.  This patchset implements it for the
openstack-dashboard

commit_message:
Policyd override implementation

This patchset implements policy overrides for octavia.  It uses the
code in charmhelpers [1] which has been modified to support the richer
and more complex approach to handling policy overrides.

[1]: https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/393

func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/126

Change-Id: Ib51fd2c7c540c680083c2928eab4ce4df0d43e23
Closed-Bug: #1741723

supporting bionic were added

commit_message:
tox: Keeping going with docs

1. Sphinx 1.8 introduced [1] the '--keep-going' argument which, as its name
suggests, keeps the build running when it encounters non-fatal errors.
This is exceptionally useful in avoiding a continuous edit-build loop
when undertaking large doc reworks where multiple errors may be
introduced.
2. Remove the unnecessary blank line for tox.ini

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/e3483e9b045

Depends-On: Ie837d376bb1a1d93367369d25140dd8a9d5ac14e
Change-Id: Iec29a958241b65cb3f7e8933169a6e55c6a39656

suggests, keeps the build running when it encounters non-fatal errors.

subject: Configure mysqld with max_allowed_packet=16M
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-08 18:12:36.000000000', 'message': 'Configure mysqld with max_allowed_packet=16M

Based on [1] and seeing it's fairly common [2] configure mysql
to use max_allowed_packet=16M to avoid aborted connection issues
seen in grenade runs.

What we're seeing in bug 1844929 is that during a grenade run
upgrading to Train, mysqld is started three times (install, devstack
old side restart, devstack new side restart) and after the final
restart we start losing connections which manifest themselves during
nova scheduling with "Timed out waiting for response from cell"
errors trying to query the nova_cell1 database.

It's not clear what might have changed in Train. To figure that out
we likely need more verbose mysqld logging enabled in a patch that
hits the failure. But for now it seems useful to try and set
max_allowed_packet to a higher size as a workaround.

[1] https://dba.stackexchange.com/questions/19135/mysql-error-reading-communication-packets/19139#19139
[2] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=max_allowed_packet&i=nope&files=&repos=

Change-Id: I2310d50dfbd704e522a45e023415c6a58fb43442
Related-Bug: #1844929
'}]
commit_message:
Configure mysqld with max_allowed_packet=16M

Based on [1] and seeing it's fairly common [2] configure mysql
to use max_allowed_packet=16M to avoid aborted connection issues
seen in grenade runs.

What we're seeing in bug 1844929 is that during a grenade run
upgrading to Train, mysqld is started three times (install, devstack
old side restart, devstack new side restart) and after the final
restart we start losing connections which manifest themselves during
nova scheduling with "Timed out waiting for response from cell"
errors trying to query the nova_cell1 database.

It's not clear what might have changed in Train. To figure that out
we likely need more verbose mysqld logging enabled in a patch that
hits the failure. But for now it seems useful to try and set
max_allowed_packet to a higher size as a workaround.

[1] https://dba.stackexchange.com/questions/19135/mysql-error-reading-communication-packets/19139#19139
[2] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=max_allowed_packet&i=nope&files=&repos=

Change-Id: I2310d50dfbd704e522a45e023415c6a58fb43442
Related-Bug: #1844929

Change Ia01c3602e764a3941d435ed779e311127d33914e in the
ComputeManager needs to create a volume attachment, complete
it and make sure to preserve some data from the BDM
connection_info. DriverVolumeBlockDevice already handles all
of that so this change extracts the needed code into helper
module-level functions so they can be reused in ComputeManager.
This is also useful on its own to DRY up the DriverVolumeBlockDevice
code.

Change-Id: I149388d2af4e68680349a336f98559cf89f44569
'}]
commit_message:
Extract some helper functions from DriverVolumeBlockDevice

Change Ia01c3602e764a3941d435ed779e311127d33914e in the
ComputeManager needs to create a volume attachment, complete
it and make sure to preserve some data from the BDM
connection_info. DriverVolumeBlockDevice already handles all
of that so this change extracts the needed code into helper
module-level functions so they can be reused in ComputeManager.
This is also useful on its own to DRY up the DriverVolumeBlockDevice
code.

Change-Id: I149388d2af4e68680349a336f98559cf89f44569

commit_message:
tox: Keeping going with docs

1. Sphinx 1.8 introduced [1] the '--keep-going' argument which, as its name
suggests, keeps the build running when it encounters non-fatal errors.
This is exceptionally useful in avoiding a continuous edit-build loop
when undertaking large doc reworks where multiple errors may be
introduced.
2. Remove the unnecessary blank line for tox.ini

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/e3483e9b045

Depends-On: Ie837d376bb1a1d93367369d25140dd8a9d5ac14e

commit_message:
Migrate from with_X loop.

With the release of Ansible 2.5, the recommended way to perform
 loops is the use the new loop keyword instead of with_X style loops.
This review addresses aforementioned change for common tasks
within tripleo-upgrade role.

Change-Id: I70d387b381b6ce297507cbfe669ea7be902df605
(cherry picked from commit b25817a233bcb5f836319cce10bb04bbb732c4f7)
(cherry picked from commit 876c3334a7bf8aa284d3088cb6797b52980f4b76)

commit_message:
Switch to more specific include modules for ffwd.

Include has some unintuitive behaviours depending on
if it is running in a static or dynamic in play or in playbook context,
in an effort to clarify behaviours move to a new set of modules:
  include_tasks, include_role, import_playbook, import_tasks.

Change-Id: I32198527a084d35f8a2c91e3e7d3f32b6fbe9e1e
(cherry picked from commit d67e6e7166d7d554b27763cf0c253737f4a189e5)

commit_message:
Switch to more specific include modules for upgrades.

Include has some unintuitive behaviours depending on
if it is running in a static or dynamic in play or in playbook context,
in an effort to clarify behaviours move to a new set of modules:
  include_tasks, include_role, import_playbook, import_tasks.

Change-Id: I08e9abfc9a39a4ca50e5c747f65b2953d34ccbfa
(cherry picked from commit 571d6b0b5b4ecbec86f72a4c4d606cf425b67dee)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-13 19:12:47.000000000', 'message': "HTTP test during update/upgrade/ffwd.

To mimic real life environment during update/upgrade/ffwd
 we'll expose a 'HTTP-live' test.
This test asserts that web server running in overcloud is
 reachable via its FIP and that content served is accessible.

To access WEB server(s) running in overcloud appropriate ports
 80 and 443 have to be added to the security group(s).

Initial work done in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/547220/

Co-Authored-By: Marius Cornea <mcornea@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I818949e0e498d5cd8da4640bda2be99aafd1aa76

commit_message:
HTTP test during update/upgrade/ffwd.

To mimic real life environment during update/upgrade/ffwd
 we'll expose a 'HTTP-live' test.
This test asserts that web server running in overcloud is
 reachable via its FIP and that content served is accessible.

To access WEB server(s) running in overcloud appropriate ports
 80 and 443 have to be added to the security group(s).

Initial work done in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/547220/

Co-Authored-By: Marius Cornea <mcornea@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I818949e0e498d5cd8da4640bda2be99aafd1aa76
(cherry picked from commit 8e55883fd0fcf1b2b06d8f88446e5dbc98006cd2)

commit_message:
Adjust roles_data also for updates.

During the update prepare process, if
some of the services defined in the roles
data where deprecated in the version to
update to, an error will be retrieved during
container image downloading as the service
is not present anymore. This patch enables
the roles_data adjusting, which was run in
upgrades, also in updates.

Change-Id: I1e1fc6471525855fb09280131e7847f21b1a74d8
Related-Bug: #1784624
(cherry picked from commit ba9879a93209ba25fdb9a5dd1d00aa3a5f33a9bf)

commit_message:
Switch to more specific include statements.

Include has some unintuitive behaviours depending on if it is running
in a static or dynamic in play or in playbook context,
in an effort to clarify behaviours we are moving to a new set modules:
 include_tasks, include_role, import_playbook, import_tasks.
Also this one might got deprecated so let switch to more specific
 modules from generic.

Note this change also include a fix for the invalid option option to
include_tasks that was not needed at the time of the original commit.

Closes-Bug: #1827906

Change-Id: Ib7ec62a4e8311c4da2af85e30eb33184d05a046f
(cherry picked from commit 2ff51bd816fae612611f8d0f1163f15447ddf1aa)
(cherry picked from commit 190d72c098ee2ff5e38fa79d2ba95a7aba8af99e)

commit_message:
Add nova-lxc job to the experimental queue

Every once in a while someone asks if the libvirt+lxc
configuration works, and we say "we don't know, we
don't test it, and last time we tried it didn't go so
well".

This adds a new nova-lxc job which just runs compute API
tests for the libvirt+lxc configuration and runs it on-demand
in the experimental queue so we can try to tease out bugs
and figure out if we can actually have integration testing
for that configuration and support it, or consider deprecating
it if we aren't going to test and support it.

Change-Id: I9dd0e3bcf97cf4a24934b9961b4d4a112c745043

commit_message:
tox: Keeping going with docs

1. Sphinx 1.8 introduced [1] the '--keep-going' argument which, as its name
suggests, keeps the build running when it encounters non-fatal errors.
This is exceptionally useful in avoiding a continuous edit-build loop
when undertaking large doc reworks where multiple errors may be
introduced.
2. Remove the unnecessary blank line for tox.ini

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/e3483e9b045

Depends-On: Ie837d376bb1a1d93367369d25140dd8a9d5ac14e
Change-Id: If351662f97efe96477291e2d81ed09fd67b57734

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-13 14:28:15.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Fix live migration _remove_host_allocations warnings

When the scheduler picks a destination host during live
migration and then the conductor task rejects the host for
some reason, like the destination hypervisor version is older
than the source, the conductor task tries to undo the allocations
created for the instance by the scheduler. This can result in
remove_provider_tree_from_instance_allocation trying to PUT
an empty "allocations" dict which results in a 400 response from
placement like:

Failed validating 'minProperties' in
schema['properties']['allocations']['items']['properties']['resources']:
...On instance['allocations'][0]['resources']: {}

Rather than PUT empty allocations, we should just delete them since
the instance allocation for the source compute node provider were
already moved to the migration record at the beginning of the live
migration task.

Change-Id: I53784e8bc9c10e452c0213578f005459e7070938
Related-Bug: #1819910
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Fix live migration _remove_host_allocations warnings

When the scheduler picks a destination host during live
migration and then the conductor task rejects the host for
some reason, like the destination hypervisor version is older
than the source, the conductor task tries to undo the allocations
created for the instance by the scheduler. This can result in
remove_provider_tree_from_instance_allocation trying to PUT
an empty "allocations" dict which results in a 400 response from
placement like:

Failed validating 'minProperties' in
schema['properties']['allocations']['items']['properties']['resources']:
...On instance['allocations'][0]['resources']: {}

Rather than PUT empty allocations, we should just delete them since
the instance allocation for the source compute node provider were
already moved to the migration record at the beginning of the live
migration task.

Change-Id: I53784e8bc9c10e452c0213578f005459e7070938
Related-Bug: #1819910

[{'created': '2019-02-26 14:48:44.000000000', 'message': "Add functional regression test for bug 1794996

The _destroy_evacuated_instances method on compute
startup tries to cleanup guests from the hypervisor
and allocations held against that compute node resource
provider by evacuated instances, but doesn't take into
account that those evacuated instances could have been
deleted in the meantime which leads to a lazy-load
InstanceNotFound error that kills the startup of the
compute service.

This change adds a functional regression test to recreate
the bug. A subsequent change with the fix will update
the test to show the bug is fixed.

Note that assertFlavorMatchesAllocation and
_boot_and_check_allocations are redefined in the test
class because If6aa37d9b6b48791e070799ab026c816fda4441c
refactored those methods which will cause problems with
backports of this test. The redefined methods will be
removed in a follow up cleanup patch.

NOTE(mriedem): The restart_compute_service() method
needed to be added to the functional test class because
change I17f67a02b27a90658df48856963ea3fb327e81dc is not
in Pike.

commit_message:
Add functional regression test for bug 1794996

The _destroy_evacuated_instances method on compute
startup tries to cleanup guests from the hypervisor
and allocations held against that compute node resource
provider by evacuated instances, but doesn't take into
account that those evacuated instances could have been
deleted in the meantime which leads to a lazy-load
InstanceNotFound error that kills the startup of the
compute service.

This change adds a functional regression test to recreate
the bug. A subsequent change with the fix will update
the test to show the bug is fixed.

Note that assertFlavorMatchesAllocation and
_boot_and_check_allocations are redefined in the test
class because If6aa37d9b6b48791e070799ab026c816fda4441c
refactored those methods which will cause problems with
backports of this test. The redefined methods will be
removed in a follow up cleanup patch.

NOTE(mriedem): The restart_compute_service() method
needed to be added to the functional test class because
change I17f67a02b27a90658df48856963ea3fb327e81dc is not
in Pike.

Change-Id: I19b0d8baea5440f5d5bc49a6956d9a97bf031a05
Related-Bug: #1794996
(cherry picked from commit d252f81573cdfe7a0966f134608bb85d17311e33)
(cherry picked from commit 83d74dbbb6b45bfeada0c0b9ac13385b126709bb)
(cherry picked from commit c3fd5e5061b837a78a95705074239c3d2e41e644)
(cherry picked from commit 91455a522738572def003dfe5e4f0bec08255074)

[{'created': '2019-02-19 17:10:55.000000000', 'message': "Set ETCD_USE_RAMDISK=True by default

Cinder and etcd are enabled by default and by default
cinder uses etcd as a distributed lock manager with
tooz as an intermediary. We see a lot of ToozConnectionErrors [1]
in the cinder logs when etcd is backed up [2] which results in

when a volume is not deleted within a given time.

commit_message:
Set ETCD_USE_RAMDISK=True by default

Cinder and etcd are enabled by default and by default
cinder uses etcd as a distributed lock manager with
tooz as an intermediary. We see a lot of ToozConnectionErrors [1]
in the cinder logs when etcd is backed up [2] which results in
cinder operations timing out causing test failures, like
when a volume is not deleted within a given time.

This changes ETCD_USE_RAMDISK=True by default to try and
alleviate some of the pressure. An alternative is if we know
we're in a single-node job we could just not use a DLM for
Cinder.

[1] http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/#1810526
[2] etcd[26824]: sync duration of 12.076762123s, expected less than 1s

Change-Id: I5f82aa40e9d84114e7b7b5cf19ec4942d6552490
Partial-Bug: #1810526
(cherry picked from commit 1516e720ce1d6eb6eca38feb1ca18dc7fc8c105c)

commit_message:
Add option to place etcd data dir on RAM disk

Seems like for etcd-heavy services like Kubernetes, the fsync
performance of gate VM's are too low [1]. This commit implements an
option to put etcd data directory on RAM disk (tmpfs) to work this
around.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-January/001849.html

Change-Id: I5a17099cb9d6941b1a009dc82daefd2c7946d892
(cherry picked from commit 6757a9c5dec32f39b984ceaaa0eb9e903602769a)

tox: Keeping going with docs

1. Sphinx 1.8 introduced [1] the '--keep-going' argument which, as its name
suggests, keeps the build running when it encounters non-fatal errors.

when undertaking large doc reworks where multiple errors may be
introduced.

commit_message:
tox: Keeping going with docs

1. Sphinx 1.8 introduced [1] the '--keep-going' argument which, as its name
suggests, keeps the build running when it encounters non-fatal errors.
This is exceptionally useful in avoiding a continuous edit-build loop
when undertaking large doc reworks where multiple errors may be
introduced.
2. Remove the unnecessary blank line for tox.ini

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/e3483e9b045

Depends-On: Ie837d376bb1a1d93367369d25140dd8a9d5ac14e
Change-Id: I6ee3ff95f2fd2c228ea1d8694ccd2423dc33c21a

Also, I want Miguel to take a look at this given my assumptions about how I thought neutron would handle the source host binding when the dest binding is deleted.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-08-21 13:13:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded.

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/594139/1 : SUCCESS in 1h 58m 53s'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-08-21 15:59:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This is the wrong fix. Sean's logs point out:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/728539/

That the migration fails and we're processing the "Migration completed" lifecycle event and that's what is triggering the activation of the dest host port binding right before we rollback and delete the dest host port binding.

From the logs:

Aug 21 16:19:16 devstack2 nova-compute[25894]: INFO nova.compute.manager [None req-c8b07cbc-52f7-4d20-aacc-f3036ad90c8d None None] [instance: fead1ca6-beab-4c47-a73e-a3ab7f7c4de2] VM Migration completed (Lifecycle Event)

Aug 21 16:19:17 devstack2 nova-compute[25894]: DEBUG nova.compute.manager [None req-c8b07cbc-52f7-4d20-aacc-f3036ad90c8d None None] [instance: fead1ca6-beab-4c47-a73e-a3ab7f7c4de2] Binding ports to destination host: devstack5 {{(pid=25894) handle_lifecycle_event /opt/stack/nova/nova/compute/manager.py:1130}}

Aug 21 16:19:17 devstack2 nova-compute[25894]: ERROR nova.virt.libvirt.driver [-] [instance: fead1ca6-beab-4c47-a73e-a3ab7f7c4de2] Live Migration failure: internal error: qemu unexpectedly closed the monitor: 2018-08-21T15:19:15.187710Z qemu-kvm: -chardev socket,id=charnet0,path=/var/run/openvswitch/vhuef02ea3f-9a,server: info: QEMU waiting

So we need to fix the libvirt driver's handling of the 'migration completed' event to not send it back up to the compute manager if the job failed.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-08-21 22:19:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

Well, we might still need this if post-copy ever fails, which can happen:

https://libvirt.org/html/libvirt-libvirt-domain.html#virDomainMigrateStartPostCopy

"VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_SUSPENDED_POSTCOPY_FAILED (on the destination) -- emitted when migration fails in post-copy mode and it's unclear whether any of the hosts has a complete guest state."'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-08-21 22:21:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-05-21 20:33:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-05-21 21:27:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Have the same issue with reverting a cross-cell resize which uses port bindings and currently deletes the active dest host port binding and then tries to update the port's binding:host_id to the source host but that fails because that only works when there is an active port binding.

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/637630/25/nova/compute/manager.py@4249"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-05-23 15:29:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

An alternative to munging this in with setup_networks_on_host is explicitly activating before calling that method to teardown and delete port bindings (this patch does overload that method quite a bit):

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/637630/26/nova/compute/manager.py@4248'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2019-09-13 15:00:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2019-09-20 19:47:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I can't speak for the need to do this from a Neutron POV, but from a Nova mechanics POV, I don't understand why we're doing this twice (if do_cleanup is True): once on the source, and a second time on the destination."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-11-04 20:07:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-11-04 20:09:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2019-11-04 20:12:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

(1 comment)

*megaderp*'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2019-11-05 15:06:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-11-05 15:28:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-11-05 16:24:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

If https://review.opendev.org/#/c/594527/ fixes the bug then we likely don't need this because this is really working around the fallout of the bug which is live migration failed, the lifecycle handler incorrectly activated the dest host port binding, and then _rollback_live_migration is called and I'm trying to delete the active dest host port bindings and re-activate the source host port bindings. If we just fix the bug to initially not activate the dest host port bindings when live migration fails, then this isn't necessary."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-11-21 16:45:58.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Let's just assume that https://review.opendev.org/#/c/594527/ fixes the bug since if we fix the root cause then we don't need to hack around cleaning up the busted port bindings."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-21 11:53:33.000000000', 'message': "Re-activate source host port bindings on live migration rollback

If we've reached the point of post-copy during live migration on the
source host and activated the destination host port bindings, but then
something fails and we have to rollback, we need to re-activate the
source host port bindings for the instance so the ports are wired up
for networking on the source host. When this was all originally written
I had assumed neutron would automatically activate the sold remaining
port binding when the dest host port binding was deleted, like how
neutron automatically deactivates the source host binding when the
dest host binding is activated, but apparently that is not the case,
so we have to do it ourselves on rollback.

Change-Id: I7e17f6bb5ee553896f6021a8c5f3fe378792ee5b
Closes-Bug: #1788014
"}]
commit_message:
Re-activate source host port bindings on live migration rollback

If we've reached the point of post-copy during live migration on the
source host and activated the destination host port bindings, but then
something fails and we have to rollback, we need to re-activate the
source host port bindings for the instance so the ports are wired up
for networking on the source host. When this was all originally written
I had assumed neutron would automatically activate the sold remaining
port binding when the dest host port binding was deleted, like how
neutron automatically deactivates the source host binding when the
dest host binding is activated, but apparently that is not the case,
so we have to do it ourselves on rollback.

Change-Id: I7e17f6bb5ee553896f6021a8c5f3fe378792ee5b
Closes-Bug: #1788014

commit_message:
tox: Keeping going with docs

1. Sphinx 1.8 introduced [1] the '--keep-going' argument which, as its name
suggests, keeps the build running when it encounters non-fatal errors.
This is exceptionally useful in avoiding a continuous edit-build loop
when undertaking large doc reworks where multiple errors may be
introduced.
2. Remove the unnecessary blank line for tox.ini

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/e3483e9b045

Depends-On: Ie837d376bb1a1d93367369d25140dd8a9d5ac14e
Change-Id: I4a931463119d0a48c83a9217b58868353170e5f3

commit_message:
WIP: Bulk query floating IPs in _nw_info_get_ips

We should be able to perform a bulk query for floating IPs
when building the network info cache model rather than iterate
over every fixed IP for each port and query Neutron one by one.

This also limits the set of fields we get back since we only need
a couple of fields in the response.

Related-Bug: #1691602

Change-Id: I89a6e58a35666d7a7b769f06667ef5187de46e36

commit_message:
DNM: Time how long _nw_info_get_ips takes

This is probably not very useful in a tempest gate run
because most servers will have only 1 or 2 ports attached
but could be used in a local devstack test scenario where
a server has more like 10 ports with several fixed IPs and
floating IPs.

The idea is to see how effective [1] is for performance.

[1] I89a6e58a35666d7a7b769f06667ef5187de46e36

Change-Id: Id5ef2e1064082afc5786454fd22ab33cf98f8552
Related-Bug: #1691602

commit_message:
tox: Keeping going with docs

1. Sphinx 1.8 introduced [1] the '--keep-going' argument which, as its name
suggests, keeps the build running when it encounters non-fatal errors.
This is exceptionally useful in avoiding a continuous edit-build loop
when undertaking large doc reworks where multiple errors may be
introduced.
2. Remove the unnecessary blank line for tox.ini

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/e3483e9b045

Depends-On: Ie837d376bb1a1d93367369d25140dd8a9d5ac14e
Change-Id: I251d81fea621c985cd0fe27a335f150ac50b94d3

commit_message:
tox: Keeping going with docs

1. Sphinx 1.8 introduced [1] the '--keep-going' argument which, as its name
suggests, keeps the build running when it encounters non-fatal errors.
This is exceptionally useful in avoiding a continuous edit-build loop
when undertaking large doc reworks where multiple errors may be
introduced.
2. Remove the unnecessary blank line for tox.ini

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/e3483e9b045

Depends-On: Ie837d376bb1a1d93367369d25140dd8a9d5ac14e
Change-Id: I4fc80984d398f5c9d5a33c6a06f688fc1e777297

Manually testing this in devstack I created a volume-backed server (where nova creates the volume from the provided image), confirmed the BDM didn't have an attachment_id set, restarted the compute service and the BDM was migrated:

Sep 30 19:32:27 devstack nova-compute[30752]: DEBUG nova.compute.manager [None req-d0de5095-1b11-4cfd-bf4c-114fc20c0a53 None None] [instance: 6c8cf6e0-4c8f-442f-9196-9679737feec6] Migrating BDM (volume_id=5d95d5ee-4bdd-4452-b9d7-d44ca10d3d53) for instance to new style volume attachments. {{(pid=30752) _migrate_legacy_volume_attachment /opt/stack/nova/nova/compute/manager.py:666}}
...
Sep 30 19:32:28 devstack nova-compute[30752]: DEBUG nova.compute.manager [None req-d0de5095-1b11-4cfd-bf4c-114fc20c0a53 None None] [instance: 6c8cf6e0-4c8f-442f-9196-9679737feec6] Created volume attachment a4b2528c-b6d3-4f18-a3fb-084e34f9608d for volume 5d95d5ee-4bdd-4452-b9d7-d44ca10d3d53 and instance. {{(pid=30752) _migrate_legacy_volume_attachment /opt/stack/nova/nova/compute/manager.py:711}}

The DB looks good:

mysql> select id,deleted,volume_id,attachment_id from block_device_mapping where instance_uuid="6c8cf6e0-4c8f-442f-9196-9679737feec6";
+----+---------+--------------------------------------+--------------------------------------+
| id | deleted | volume_id                            | attachment_id                        |
+----+---------+--------------------------------------+--------------------------------------+
|  2 |       0 | 5d95d5ee-4bdd-4452-b9d7-d44ca10d3d53 | a4b2528c-b6d3-4f18-a3fb-084e34f9608d |
+----+---------+--------------------------------------+--------------------------------------+
1 row in set (0.00 sec)

And the volume is in-use because we completed the attachment that was created:

$ openstack volume show 5d95d5ee-4bdd-4452-b9d7-d44ca10d3d53 -f value -c status
in-use


I deleted the server and the volume was detached successfully but not deleted (I used openstack server create --boot-from-volume which passes delete_on_termination=False for the BDM):

Sep 30 19:36:33 devstack nova-compute[30752]: INFO nova.compute.manager [None req-2941c0e9-6952-4a32-8494-83da176e4624 demo demo] [instance: 6c8cf6e0-4c8f-442f-9196-9679737feec6] Took 0.19 seconds to detach 1 volumes for instance.

The remaining problem here though is the volume status is still in-use:

$ openstack volume show 5d95d5ee-4bdd-4452-b9d7-d44ca10d3d53 -f value -c status
in-use

Maybe cinder is still tracking an internal attachment? Yup:

$ openstack volume show 5d95d5ee-4bdd-4452-b9d7-d44ca10d3d53 -f value -c attachments
[{u'server_id': u'6c8cf6e0-4c8f-442f-9196-9679737feec6', u'attachment_id': u'3dafcac4-1cb9-4b60-a227-d729baa10cf6', u'attached_at': u'2019-09-30T19:30:34.000000', u'host_name': None, u'volume_id': u'5d95d5ee-4bdd-4452-b9d7-d44ca10d3d53', u'device': u'/dev/vda', u'id': u'5d95d5ee-4bdd-4452-b9d7-d44ca10d3d53'}]

That has attachment 3dafcac4-1cb9-4b60-a227-d729baa10cf6 attached at 19:30:34 and we created attachment a4b2528c-b6d3-4f18-a3fb-084e34f9608d at 19:32:28.

Maybe as part of the migration we need to first find an attachment record for the legacy attachment, 3dafcac4-1cb9-4b60-a227-d729baa10cf6 in this case, and delete that after we've completed the new attachment, similar to an old os-terminate_connection call on the old attachment? But that might not work if that original attachment is not stored as an attachment resource:

$ curl -X "DELETE" -H "X-Auth-Token: $token" http://10.128.0.5/volume/v3/90f34273b92d49a088eabdd292d38057/attachments/3dafcac4-1cb9-4b60-a227-d729baa10cf6
{"itemNotFound": {"message": "The resource could not be found.", "code": 404}}

Looking in the cinder volume attachment table:

mysql> select id,deleted,instance_uuid from volume_attachment where volume_id="5d95d5ee-4bdd-4452-b9d7-d44ca10d3d53";
+--------------------------------------+---------+--------------------------------------+
| id                                   | deleted | instance_uuid                        |
+--------------------------------------+---------+--------------------------------------+
| 3dafcac4-1cb9-4b60-a227-d729baa10cf6 |       0 | 6c8cf6e0-4c8f-442f-9196-9679737feec6 |
| a4b2528c-b6d3-4f18-a3fb-084e34f9608d |       1 | 6c8cf6e0-4c8f-442f-9196-9679737feec6 |
+--------------------------------------+---------+--------------------------------------+
2 rows in set (0.00 sec)

a4b2528c-b6d3-4f18-a3fb-084e34f9608d is gone because nova deleted it when the server was deleted, so why can't we find 3dafcac4-1cb9-4b60-a227-d729baa10cf6?

I also tried the DELETE curl request with an admin token and I get a 404 back.

I don't see anything else going on here though:

https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/5b4134168f679a446a391acf14f1b64ba0186d6b/cinder/api/v3/attachments.py#L269'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-09-30 20:16:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

OK my problems was not specifying the microversion in the curl DELETE request, I fixed that and it works:

$ curl -X "DELETE" -H "X-Auth-Token: $token" -H "OpenStack-API-Version: volume 3.44" http://10.128.0.5/volume/v3/90f34273b92d49a088eabdd292d38057/attachments/3dafcac4-1cb9-4b60-a227-d729baa10cf6
{"attachments": []}

DB is updated to show the volume attachment is deleted:

mysql> select id,deleted,volume_id,instance_uuid from volume_attachment where id="3dafcac4-1cb9-4b60-a227-d729baa10cf6";                                                     +--------------------------------------+---------+--------------------------------------+--------------------------------------+
| id                                   | deleted | volume_id                            | instance_uuid                        |
+--------------------------------------+---------+--------------------------------------+--------------------------------------+
| 3dafcac4-1cb9-4b60-a227-d729baa10cf6 |       1 | 5d95d5ee-4bdd-4452-b9d7-d44ca10d3d53 | 6c8cf6e0-4c8f-442f-9196-9679737feec6 |
+--------------------------------------+---------+--------------------------------------+--------------------------------------+
1 row in set (0.00 sec)

And the volume is now available:

$ openstack volume show 5d95d5ee-4bdd-4452-b9d7-d44ca10d3d53 -f value -c status
available'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-09-30 20:20:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Just need to resolve the TODOs and talk with the Cinder team about whether or not terminate_connection should be used for the legacy attachment or if just deleting it is good enough.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-10-03 23:06:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-37971 : FAILURE in 2h 16m 48s'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-11-21 16:41:13.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

I'm just going to drop this. It's been hanging around a long time and Gorka doesn't like what is proposed:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010185.html

I think his suggestion is Cinder making an API change:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010059.html

"2- Write new code in Cinder

The new code can be either a new action or we can just add a
microversion to attachment create to also accept "connection_info", and
when we provide connection_info on the call the method confirms that
it's a "migration" (the volume is 'in-use' and doesn't have any
attachments) and it doesn't bother to call the cinder-volume to export
and map the volume again and simply saves this information in the DB."

If that's the route that needs to be taken then sure but it's going to require more work on both sides (cinder and nova) than I'm going to do with this anymore.

It's also possible that during migrations of a server we just detect the old thing, terminate the connection and create a new attachment so that when we finish on the new target server we are using the new flow with the new attachment rather than calling os-initialize_connection again. That's good, but if someone never migrates a really old pet created before Queens then we still can't drop the compat code for legacy volume attachments.

Anyway, it's someone else's problem now.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-02 08:48:12.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Migrate old style volume attachments on nova-compute startup

This adds an online data migration routine for volume BDMs when
nova-compute starts. This looks for all non-deleted volume BDMs
for instances running on the host which do not have an attachment_id
set indicating they were created before the compute API used the
Cinder 3.44 microversion to create 'new style' attachments.

For those BDMs found, the migration routine creates a 'new style'
attachment with the host connector, from the virt driver, per
instance/BDM combination.

This allows operators to online migrate the volume attachment data
so that we can eventually remove the compatibility code for the old
volume attach flows.

Change-Id: Ia01c3602e764a3941d435ed779e311127d33914e

commit_message:
WIP: Migrate old style volume attachments on nova-compute startup

TODO: needs unit tests for error cases

This adds an online data migration routine for volume BDMs when
nova-compute starts. This looks for all non-deleted volume BDMs
for instances running on the host which do not have an attachment_id
set indicating they were created before the compute API used the
Cinder 3.44 microversion to create 'new style' attachments.

Note that it wasn't until Train that we required Queens level Cinder
with the 3.44 API [1] and even before that, volumes that nova
created during boot from volume were not created with a new style
attachment [2]. The point is we could have recently attached volumes
that need to be migrated, not just pre-Queens era BDMs.

For those BDMs found, the migration routine creates a 'new style'
attachment with the host connector, from the virt driver, per
instance/BDM combination.

This allows operators to online migrate the volume attachment data
so that we can eventually remove the compatibility code for the old
volume attach flows.

[1] I6a777b4b7a5729488f939df8c40e49bd40aec3dd
[2] I30a49c9e085cffc071d0ba332db67945e116bc80

Change-Id: Ia01c3602e764a3941d435ed779e311127d33914e

[{'created': '2019-09-25 22:09:38.000000000', 'message': 'Clear RT.compute_nodes entry if re-balance update fails

During an ironic node rebalance from host1 to host2, there
can be a race where host2 detects the rebalance, adds the
ComputeNode object its ResourceTracker.compute_nodes dict
and then try to update/refresh associations for the resource
provider in placement. Between the time that host2 has
cached the ComputeNode object and refreshed associations in
placement, host1's update_available_resource periodic task
can run, detect it no longer manages the node, and consider
it orphaned and delete the compute node record from the nova
DB and the resource provider from placement. When the
resource provider is deleted via host1 in this race window,
the association refresh in host2 fails because the provider
is gone. As a result, host2 has stale entries in the RT
compute_nodes dict and possible the ProviderTree cache.

This resolves the issue by simply handling the failure
to refresh assocations and remove the RT.compute_nodes entry,
like the fix for bug 1839674, so that on the next run of
update_available_resource on host2 it will re-create the
compute node (note this depends on the fix for bug 1839560 to
"re-create" the soft deleted compute node record) and the
resource provider.

Change-Id: Iffb802cf9c84550e919d5b2865d05fe172907190
Closes-Bug: #1841481
'}, {'created': '2019-09-26 13:39:16.000000000', 'message': 'Clear RT.compute_nodes entry if re-balance update fails
